page.title: 05RESERVOIR AND RECREATION
page.content: Loch Glow is very popular with anglers. The Loch is controlled by Rosyth Civil Service Sports Association's Angling Section. Approximately 50 members take out season tickets which enable them to fish at any time. Day permits are also available to members of the public through club members, agents and commercial outlets. Charges at June 1985 are Â£2 per adult and Â£1 for juniors and old age pensioners. Approximately 1000 adult tickets and 500 child/pensioner tickets are sold annually. Because of the pressure of fishing the Loch must be stocked artificially. Brown Trout and Rainbow Trout are injected in mid-season and in October.
